summary: This bill, the Smith River National Recreation Area Expansion Act, aims to expand the Smith River National Recreation Area to include additions in Oregon. It details definitions, boundary adjustments, and administrative directives for the expanded area. The bill mandates a study of the proposed additions, addresses wildfire and vegetation management, and clarifies the application of existing plans and rules. It also covers acquisition of land, fish and game regulations, and management planning, including the revision of the area's management plan to accommodate the expansion. The bill further designates segments of the North Fork Smith River and its tributaries in Oregon as Wild and Scenic Rivers.
